title: Install and Update R
text: article installing R installed updating R needed. R already installed, skip installation chapter.

text: R installed “softwareshoppen” found desktop. Click “installer” “bestil” wait couple minutes.  instillation R, also need install R-studio

title: Install and Update R
text: R can updated directly R, “softwareshoppen” always --date. requires specific package called “installr”. installation needs run directly R R-studio.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mathias Ørholt. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ørholt M (2025). cancR: cancR. R package version 1.0.0, https://matorholt.github.io/cancR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cancR: cancR},   author = {Mathias Ørholt},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://matorholt.github.io/cancR/}, }

title: cancR
text: cancR package developed conducting epidemiological cancer research R. package functions spans across entire project workflow, data management outputting results.

title: cancR
text: detailed walkthrough install cancR package provided article “Get Started”

title: cancR
text: functions divided chapters: - Data management - Statistical analyses - Tables figures - Register-specific functions - Miscellaneous utility functions Furthermore package offers internal simulated dataset testing functions.

title: cancR
text: website includes numerous articles related directly package general R-guides. chapter separate articles thorough examples functions.

title: cancR
text: package regularly maintained updated. Bugs suggestions welcome sent package developer.

title: cancR
text: package developer wishes thank developers prodlim, riskRegression, heaven, mets, rrapply tidyverse incredible work. package merely just highlighting qualities packages.

title: cancR
text: cancR package mainly internal use Research Group Department Plastic Surgery, Rigshospitalet, Copenhagen, Denmark. use cancR package must consulted developer package. take responsibility use package without prior consultation us, consequences may result use.

title: Generation of time-dependent CCI and comorbidities from the Charlson Comorbidity Index — cci_timR
text: data Full LPR dataset interval Interval CCIs calculated structure Whether CCI full 18 parametres binned 1, 2-3, 4-5 6+ format Whether output long wide format comorb Whether specific comorbidites CCI score extracted. Default FALSE.

title: Generation of time-dependent CCI and comorbidities from the Charlson Comorbidity Index — cci_timR
text: cci_full_long/wide: Dates CCI scores. Repeted scores adjacent rows removed status changed. cci_bin_long/wide: cci_all CCI scores binned 1, 2-3, 4-5 6+ comorb_long/wide: Dates comorbidites

title: Detection of positivity violations (empty levels) — checkR
text: data data frame detect positivity violations treatment main stratum covariates include levels (optional) outcome outcome variable covariates include levels (optional) vars covariates examine positivity violations. State multiple variables c(var1, var2, var3) without quotes. levels number combinations covariates. level=1 (default) corresponds 2x2 table, whereas level=2 corresponds 2x2 tables stratified e.g. treatment quantiles quantiles binning continuous covariates id column indicating unique patient identifier returning specific NAs

title: Detection of positivity violations (empty levels) — checkR
text: prints variables positivity violations present. Otherwise none detected. Also returns either NULL character downstream use.

what: Absolute risk estimation of time-to-event data with competing risks — estimatR
title: Absolute risk estimation of time-to-event data with competing risks — estimatR
text: Absolute risk estimation comparison two groups time--event outcome. Wrapper prodlim ate-functions riskRegression.

title: Absolute risk estimation of time-to-event data with competing risks — estimatR
code: estimatR(   data,   timevar,   event,   group,   survscale = "AM",   type = "uni",   vars,   form,   time = 120,   breaks = 12,   survtime = T,   proportions = F,   conditional = F,   pl = T,   digits = 4,   event.digits = 2 )

title: Absolute risk estimation of time-to-event data with competing risks — estimatR
text: data dataset timevar Time variable event Status indicator group Grouping variable survscale Whether overall survial estimated survival -cause mortality (1-survival) type Model specification, Can univariate ("uni"), Age- sex standardized ("age-sex"), Multivariate variable selection ("select"). case vars vector covariates. "custom" allows free modelling form-argument contains formula. vars applicable "select" chosen type. variables added model additive model form applicable "custom" chosen type. Free specification model right-hand side formula. time Time horizon interest. Defaults 60 (e.g. 5-years) breaks Interim time points interest. Defaults 12 months (1-year gaps) survtime Whether median time event calculated (default = F) proportions Whether risk event different windows estimated (default = F) conditional Whether conditional risk time horizon calculated (default = F) pl Whether product.limit ATE shoulde T F (default = T) digits rounding eventtimes event.digits whether eventtimes rounded. Default 2 preserve exact times

title: Absolute risk estimation of time-to-event data with competing risks — estimatR
text: time_to_event: Median survival time  table: Event table  plot_data: Data plotting CIF curves  hr: Hazard ratio groups  models: Model objects (cause1 cause2)  diag: Diagnostics assessing proportionality  risks: Absolute risk estimates specified time points  differences: Absolute risk difference specified time horizons  ratios: Absolute risk ratios specified time horizon  counts: Event group counts contrasted groups  proportions:  "" estimates risk event within certain timepoint (e.g. x% events occurred within).  "" estimates risk residual events timepoint x ten years.  "Window" estimates percentage events within six month windows (e.g. x% events occurred t1 t2)  conditional: Conditional risk estimates  info: information arguments extraction

title: Causal inference of time-to-event data — inferencR
text: data dataframe treatment column indicating treatment variable. Currently binary treatments supported. timevar Time variable event Status indicator vars variables treatment, censoring event models include outcome.vars variables included outcome models time Time horizon interest. Defaults 60 (e.g. 5-years) breaks Interim time points interest. Defaults 12 months (1-year gaps) estimator whether estimator "IPTW", "GFORMULA" "AIPTW" (default) survtime Whether median time event calculated (default = F) survscale Whether overall survial estimated survival -cause mortality (1-survival) bins bins weights plot, default = 0.5 digits rounding eventtimes event.digits whether eventtimes rounded. Default 2 preserve exact times

code: plotR(   list,   y = 100,   col = cancR_palette,   table.col = "#616161",   risk.col = T,   time.unit = "m2y",   labs = levels,   print.est = TRUE,   contrast = "rd",   se = T,   border = T,   style = NULL,   linewidth = 1,   title = "",   title.size = 7,   x.title = unit,   x.title.size = 6,   x.title.shift = 0,   x.text.size = 6,   y.title = "Risk of Event (%)",   y.title.size = 6,   y.title.shift = 0,   y.text.size = 6,   res.size = 5,   res.shift = c(0, 0),   res.spacing = 1,   res.digits = 1,   border.shift = 0,   contrast.digits = 1,   table = c("event", "risk"),   table.space = 1,   table.padding = 1,   table.title.size = 6,   table.text.size = 5,   table.linewidth = 1,   border.linewidth = 1,   legend.pos = c(0.5, 0.9),   tscale = 1,   censur = F )

title: Autoplot for estimatR, incidencR, inferencR and clustR — plotR
text: list object class estimatR, incidencR clustR y Upper limit y-axis col Vector colors table.col Grid color risk.col Whether risk table numbers colored (T/F) time.unit Specification time-unit optional conversion. Conversions include Months years ("m2y"), days years ("d2y") days months ("d2m") labs Character vector similar length number levels group labels. Reference first. print.est Whether absolute risks time horizon printet. Defaults TRUE contrast type contrast provided. Includes risk difference ("rd", default), risk ratio ("rr"), hazard ratio ("hr") "none". se whether confidence interval shown border whether borders around results style formatting style contrast. Currently JAMA italic linewidth thickness risk curve lines title Plot title title.size Plot title size x.title X-axis title x.title.size X-axis title size x.title.shift X-axis vertical shift x.text.size X-axis text size y.title Y-axis title y.title.size Y-axis title size y.title.shift Y-axis title horizontal shift y.text.size Y-axis text.size res.size Size results res.shift Vector XY shifting results res.spacing Vertical spacing results res.digits Number digits risk estimates border.shift Horizontal shifting right border contrast.digits Number digits contrasts table parts risk table provided ("event", "risk", "none"). Default c("event", "risk") table.space Spacing counts risk table table.padding Spacing lines first/last rows risk table table.title.size Risk table titles size table.text.size Risk table text size table.linewidth Risk table linewidth border.linewidth Results box linewidth legend.pos XY vector legend position percentage tscale Global size scaler censur Whether values <= 3 censored. Default = FALSE
